abstract: Vikram Pandit is playing a dangerous game with Citigroup’s public image in his battle for Wachovia.
snippet: Vikram Pandit is playing a dangerous game with Citigroup’s public image in his battle for Wachovia.
lead_paragraph: Vikram Pandit is playing a dangerous game with Citigroup’s public image in his battle for Wachovia. The more Citi stakes its claim to Wachovia on the terms it reached a week ago, the worse it looks to shareholders, regulators, legislators and the bank’s customers.

byline.original: By George Hay and Rob Cox

abstract: In an address that was at once sobering but hopeful, Ben S. Bernanke hinted strongly that the Fed would lower interest rates at its meeting this month.
snippet: In an address that was at once sobering but hopeful, Ben S. Bernanke hinted strongly that the Fed would lower interest rates at its meeting this month.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, said on Tuesday that the turmoil in the financial markets had increased the risk to overall growth and that federal regulators would have to be vigilant to halt the slide.

headline.main: With Outlook Dim, Bernanke Says Fed May Act on Rates
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Hints at a Rate Cut

byline.original: By David Stout and Edmund L. Andrews

abstract: The Standard & Poor 500 is now 48 percent below its peak.
snippet: The Standard & Poor 500 is now 48 percent below its peak.
lead_paragraph: Stocks just keep falling. The market got a lot closer today to the milestone I mentioned Monday — S.&P. 967. The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index ended the day down almost 6 percent, at 996. Before today, it had not closed below 1,000 since 2003.
